name: The Minaret (The Lighthouse of Algiers)

core_content.history: Standing at 265 meters, this is the tallest minaret in the world, surpassing the Hassan II Mosque. It serves not just as a call to prayer, but as a lighthouse guiding ships in the Bay of Algiers.
core_content.architecture: The design fuses modern engineering with traditional Moorish style. It has 43 floors and houses a museum and research center.
core_content.atmosphere: Majestic, vertigo-inducing, and dominating the skyline.

secrets: It is built to withstand a major earthquake of magnitude 9.0.
The top observation deck offers a view all the way to the Casbah.

name: The Prayer Hall (Salle de Pri√®re)

core_content.history: This massive hall can accommodate 120,000 worshippers. It is a feat of engineering, with a central dome that seems to float on light.
core_content.architecture: The carpet alone is a masterpiece, designed with Algerian floral motifs. The chandeliers are made of Swarovski crystals.
core_content.atmosphere: Serene, vast, and filled with a golden spiritual glow.

secrets: The calligraphy on the walls was carved by hand by local artisans.

name: The Courtyard (The Sahn)

core_content.history: A transitional space between the city and the sanctuary. It is designed to be a place of gathering and reflection before entering prayer.
core_content.architecture: Lined with marble columns and fountains that echo the Alhambra in Granada.
core_content.atmosphere: Bright, open, and rhythmic with the sound of water.

secrets: The geometric patterns on the floor point towards Mecca.
It uses a natural cooling system inspired by ancient desert palaces.

name: The Islamic Garden (Gardens of Paradise)

core_content.history: Inspired by the Quranic description of paradise, this garden features fruit trees, aromatic plants, and flowing streams.
core_content.architecture: A grid layout typical of Persian and Andalusian gardens (Chahar Bagh).
core_content.atmosphere: Fragrant, peaceful, and full of life.

secrets: Every tree species planted here is mentioned in the Quran.
It serves as a green lung for the surrounding urban area.

name: The Cultural Center & Library

core_content.history: This mosque is not just for prayer; it is a university of knowledge. The library holds over 1 million books.
core_content.architecture: Modern glass facades blended with wood lattice screens (Mashrabiya) to filter sunlight.

secrets: It contains a laboratory for restoring ancient manuscripts.
The digital archive is accessible to researchers worldwide.
